metadata.description: Prefix for resource names. Must start with a letter and be 3 to 10 characters.
Azure region for the deployment
Storage account name for the deployment scripts
Name of the managed identity for the resource group
Name of the key vault to store credentials
Name of the secret to create in the key vault for the private SSH key
Identifier for SSH key creation script. Script will only re-run if changed.
Flag to determine whether to register the deployment (for debug only)
Flag to determine whether to run the script prerequisites (for debug only)
Flag to determine whether to create the key vault (for debug only)
Flag to determine whether to deploy Azure monitor for resources
Flag to determine whether to deploy a management VM for the cluster
Flag to determine whether to deploy a bastion service to access the environment
Flag to determine whether to deploy the private Azure Container Registry (debug only)
Flag to determine whether to deploy the Azure Kubernetes Service (debug only)
Flag to determine whether to deploy SIP (debug only)
Flag to determine whether to update the DNS with the ingress IP (debug only)
Name for the analytics workspace
Days to retain logs. Use -1 for unlimited SKU. 730 is the maximum for all other SKU's
SKU for the log analytics service.
SKU for the bastion service
Disable ability to copy and paste to bastion session
DNS name for the Bastion front end if required
Enable the file copy feature of the bastion service
Enable the IP Connect feature of the bastion service
Enable the kerberos feature of the bastion service
Enable the Shareable link feature of the bastion service
Enable the tunneling feature of the bastion service
Name of the container registry
Container Registry SKU
Enable or disable registry zone redundancy and associated duplication
Flag to determine whether hosts should have host-level encryption enabled, "Encryption At Host" (requires activation for Azure subscription)
Public SSH Key for the AKS nodes
Name for the AKS cluster
SKU tier for the AKS cluster.
Flag to determine whether the AKS cluster will private only - i.e. will not have any public ingress
Flag to determine whether local kubernetes accounts should be disabled. Setting this requires all users to be defined in EntraID
Flag to determine whether the AKS pod identity profile should be enabled. Requires feature to be enabled in subscription
Flag to determine whether to enable AKS EntraID integration
Flag to determine whether to enable EntraID RBAC authentication for kubernetes users
EntraID group object Id that will have admin access to the AKS cluster. Only valid and required if AAD RBAC is enabled.
Tenant Id for the EntraID group object that will have admin access to the AKS cluster. Only valid if AAD RBAC is enabled.
Version of kubneretes to be used for the AKS cluster
Domain name prefix for the AKS cluster
Flag to determine whether to use RBAC for the AKS cluster
Flag to determine whether to enable Azure policy in the AKS cluster
Default administrator user for AKS nodes
Scan interval for the auto-scaler of the AKS cluster.
Auto scaler scale down delay after add for the AKS cluster.
Auto scaler scale down delay after delete for the AKS cluster.
Auto scaler scale down delay after failure for the AKS cluster.
Auto-scaler scale down unneeded time for the AKS cluster.
Auto-scaler scale down unready time for the AKS cluster.
Auto-scaler utilization threshold for the AKS cluster.
Auto-scaler maximum graceful termination time interval in seconds for the AKS cluster.
The name of the AKS control node pool
The type of VM pool for the control nodes - virtual machine set or availability set
Number of AKS control nodes to deploy by default
VM size of each AKS control plane node
Size in GiB of the OS disk for the AKS control plan nodes
Maximum number of AKS control plane nodes to scale up to
Flag to determine whether to use auto scaling with the AKS control plane nodes
Auto-scaler priority for the AKS control plan nodes
Auto-scaler eviction policy for the AKS control plan nodes
Array of the availability zones to be used for the AKS control plane nodes (only relevant when pool type is virtual machine scale set.)
Maximum number of pods that can run on an AKS control plane node
Additional labels for the AKS control plane nodes
The name of the AKS control node pool
The type of VM pool for the system nodes - virtual machine set or availability set
Number of AKS control nodes to deploy by default
VM size of each AKS control plane node
Size in GiB of the OS disk for the AKS worker plan nodes
Maximum number of AKS worker plane nodes to scale up to
Flag to determine whether to use auto scaling with the AKS worker plane nodes
Auto-scaler priority for the AKS worker plane nodes
Auto-scaler eviction policy for the AKS worker plane nodes
Array of the availability zones to be used for the AKS worker plane nodes (only relevant when pool type is virtual machine scale set.)
Maximum number of pods that can run on an AKS worker plane node
Additional labels for the AKS worker plane nodes
Array of additional taints for the AKS worker plane nodes
Flag to determine whether to enable encryption at host on AKS cluster nodes. Not supported on all VM sizes or Azure regions. Refer https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/aks/enable-host-encryption
Flag to determine whether to enable FIPS on AKS cluster nodes. Refer to https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/use-multiple-node-pools#add-a-fips-enabled-node-pool-preview
Flag to determine whether to enable Ultra SSD support for the AKS cluster nodes
IP address prefix for the internal AKS services
IP address for the internal DNS service. Must be within the serviceCIDR
IP address prefix for the docker bridge network. Must not overlap with any other internal or external IP addresses.
IP address prefix for the pod network when kubenet is used
Specifies the type of AKS network plugin to be used - azure, kubenet or none
Specifies the network policy for building networks in the AKS cluster - Calico, Cilium or Azure
Resource group containing the virtual network
Name of the virtual network
Flag to determine whether the virtual network already exists
CIDR for Virtual Network
Routing method for outbound traffic
Name of the NAT gateway to create if using NAT for outbound traffic
Name of the public IP prefix if using NAT Gateway routing
Specifies the length of the public IP prefix.
CIDR for the AKS subnet
Name of the AKS subnet
IP address CIDR for the AKS pod IP address when azure network plugin is used. Must have sufficient IP addresses for all possible pods.
Subnet name for the AKS pod IP address when azure network plugin is used.
Name of the subnet to attach the private link services to
Address prefix for the private link subnet
Name of the subnet to attach the deployment script container to
Address prefix for the script subnet
CIDR for the bastion subnet
Subnet name to attach to VM
Address prefix for the management VM subnet
Admin user for created VM
Default admin password or SSH key for VM
Type of VM authentication. SSH Key or Password
Size of AKS management VM
OS Disk type for Dev VM
Availability zone for the Management VM
Flag to indicate whether a public ip address should be created.
Name for the public IP address if creating.
Domain name prefix for the public IP address
Flag to determine whether deployment will have access from the internet or not. Set true to only allow access from VNet.
IBM Container Regisry (icr.io) entitlement key
Password to be used for the trust store
The base64 encoded JWT public key to be used
OMS Gateway catalog version
IBM Order Management System gateway operator catalog image
SIP Catalog Version
IBM Sterling Intelligent Promising operator catalog image
SIP Application image tag
OMS Gateway operator starting CSV version
SIP operator starting CSV version
Namespace in AKS for the operators
Namespace in AKS for the created instances
URL to the file containing the list of Red Hat images to pull
URL to the file containing the list of SIP images to pull
Persistent Volume Claim (PVC) name for the SIP persistent volume
Size of the PVC for the SIP persistent volume
DNS Zone of the domain name to update with the SIP ingress IP
Resource group containing the DNS zone to update
Accept the license terms. Required to create an instance.
Tags for resources
Github branch for linked deployments.
Deployment version to use

resources.comments: This is the deployment identifier for BYOL SIP

createSshKey
resources.comments: Creates a new SSH key and stores in keyvault if no public key is provided
